byline.contributor: Dimitris Bounias contributed reporting from Nea Kavala, Thessaloniki, and Athens, and Nikolas Leontopoulos from Lesbos, Greece.

abstract: Migrants stranded along Greek border after Europe closed its borders to refugees face unending limbo, as international attention has strayed from their plight and help has ground to halt; confinement to camps has reduced profile of 57,000 migrants, who grapple with squalid conditions, lack of medical care and food and toll of constant uncertainty.

headline.print_headline: Bleak Times for Marooned Migrants in Greece
headline.main: Aid and Attention Dwindling, Migrant Crisis Intensifies in Greece

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: Tens of thousands of asylum seekers are languishing in camps, with more trickling in, and neither Western and Northern Europe nor Turkey are doing much to help....
lead_paragraph: Tens of thousands of asylum seekers are languishing in camps, with more trickling in, and neither Western and Northern Europe nor Turkey are doing much to help.
